entry.title: Forking personal "vanity" versions...
entry.summary: In a discussion thread, Alan Grimes responded to those who think there are too many vanity versions of bitcoin. He questioned whether there is a 'vanity version' that removes the use of libdb or requires the user to not have its development headers installed on their system. It seems that he is pointing out the importance of libdb and its development headers in using bitcoin. However, it is unclear what exactly he means by 'vanity version'. The context suggests that there might be different versions of bitcoin available, but it is not clear how they differ from each other.
